text: The Assumption Cathedral Cathedral of the Assumption in Chania () also called Catholic Cathedral of Chania and alternatively Cathedral of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary is the Roman Catholic cathedral in Chania, on the island of Crete in Greece. ==History== Interior view It was built in 1879 by the first Catholic bishop of Crete, Aloisio Cannavo, to serve the entire Catholic population of the region. In 2004, the cathedral celebrated its 125th anniversary. The church is under the responsibility of the Capuchin Order. The cathedral follows the Roman or Latin rite and is the seat of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Crete (Dioecesis Candiensis or Επισκοπή Κρήτης) that was originally created in 1213 and was restored by Pope Pius IX in 1874. ==See also== *Roman Catholicism in Greece ==References== Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Greece Category:Buildings and structures in Chania Category:Roman Catholic churches completed in 1879 Category:Churches in Crete Category:19th-century churches in Greece
title: Assumption Cathedral, Chania
